intro: Streptocarpus leandrii var. leandrii, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to white. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with broad, glossy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Streptocarpus leandrii var. leandrii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
